listing.description: Built originally in 1806 and set within a plot of approximately 5 acres, is this stunning character country home. The flexible accommodation comprises on the ground floor, large l-shaped living room with Inglenook fireplace housing log burner, family room and dining room, also with log burner. Off the dining room there is a conservatory and further study with utility and downstairs WC. The kitchen/breakfast room offers a comprehensive range of base and eye level units with stone flooring. A particular feature of the property is the annexe, which boasts large open plan living/kitchen area, separate bedroom and shower room. On the first floor there are four bedrooms, with the principal room offering ensuite facilities and roof terrace and family bathroom. Outside, the property is accessed via a 5 bar gate, to a gravelled driveway. There is a large full height 4 bay barn, with double stable block, with a full height 3 bay barn ideal for car parking and workshop. The formal gardens comprise of an expanse of lawn, with summerhouse offering power and lighting, there is a kitchen garden and two orchards with three further paddocks.
listing.short_description: Country home. Approximately 5 Acres. Annexe. Outbuildings. Flexible acommodation. Development Potential.

listing.description: Aston Wood is currently classified as a brownfield site, with B1 use. The breezeblock constructed building is in a poor state, mainly due to a fire. The la have indicated that further buildings and an extension of the existing building may be considered. The site is currently used as commercial premises and was previously a herb nursery open to the public.We consider that there could be a variety of users on the site. Although the site has houses on either side, it is currently outside the settlement boundary. The site has good road access and communications and has mains water and electricity on site, along with further water services which used to supply the poly tunnels.There is plenty of hardstanding and parking, all the boundaries are well defined, as identified on the enclosed plan.The plans identify the layout of the building, but there was a fire and some of the areas within the building have some fire damage.

listing.description: Amazing investment opportunity- This spacious detached building under construction on a generous 1/3 acre plot with far reaching views over the South Downs. Situated in the quiet and sought after village of Bletchingley, the building sits within walking distance to local village amenities such as post office, shops, hairdressers, tea rooms and pubs. The property is approached via a private roadway at the end of Castle Square, a short road off the A25 as you enter the village from the direction of Redhill. The property is built on the footprint of the Western wing of a former Victorian mansion Castle Hill, which was substantially demolished in the 1950's. It is located in a cluster of houses converted from the former stable block and kennels and the restored portion of the remaining service wing of Castle Hill, now converted into 6 luxury apartments. The Orangery offers some 3000 sq ft of flexible accommodation arranged in two sections: A two storied North wing housing an open plan workshop/office with WC and kitchen facilities (B1) above a 4 bay garage (B8), and a substantial orangery building (C3) set at right angles and to the south of it. The North building is now substantially complete with works under way to complete the orangery portion. The current use of the building allows a wide variety of activities as could be carried out on a residential site save for permanent occupation. There is clearly an opportunity for planning gain. Bletchingley is excellently served for transport links, Junction 6 of the M25 allowing quick access to London and via the M23 to Brighton, is less than 5 minutes drive away. Rail links too are close and convenient, with fast lines to London from Redhill, Oxted and Caterham. Gatwick Airport and the Gatwick Express to London are 20 minutes drive, Heathrow is 45 minutes and Dover just over an hour. A site inspection is highly recommended, so make sure you call Choices now to book your viewing.*Detached property under construction of 3200 sq ft*Orangery providing light & space*Four garages offering ample storage & parking*Outside space useful for both leisure & work purposes*Elevated location with far reaching views*Set on a third of an acre plot*Flexible and unique accommodation throughout*no onward chain

listing.description: The planning consent is for a house of 6,600 sq ft. Documents can be found on the East Herts District Council Planning website, reference 3/17/1900/ful.Planning for a new home is virtually impossible in the wellpond Green area as it is an area of development constraint. Approval for this was only achieved after many years and by sacrificing a large workshop situated on the rear plot so this will be demolished as part of the building work. The site at the rear is available if the buyer requires both front and rear plots.The accommodation as approved includes features as below. These can be varied (subject to approval) to meet personal tastes.Galleried entrance hall with a roof lantern giving light, three reception rooms set off a central corridor, kitchen/dining room, utility, larder and boot room, On the first floor, there are five bedroom suites. Outside, there will be a detached garage block and mature gardens including a fine orchard. The site extends to about 1.1 acres. Full plans and drawings available on request.This is a lightly wooded area containing some of the most valuable houses in the area and a virtually perfect position for commuting. The A10 and M11 are both within 5 miles, there is a mainline station in Bishops Stortford about 6 miles away with regular services to London Liverpool Street, Cambridge and Stansted Airport. There are excellent private and state schools in the area.Agents Notes: Savings in stamp duty could be around £200,000 and as a new build it is zero rated for VAT also saving 20% on the build costs. Changing the layout of the rooms, main windows even the position within the plot could all be modified with a simple planning variation. For example the principle rooms with lovely views can be at the front, to the left and at ground level on rear and right hand sides. If desired, a smaller houe design would be possible (possibly requiring planning consent).The hamlet of Wellpond Green is a highly regarded area well known for its outstanding beauty and mix of exclusive homes. Local facilities area available at the nearby villages of Much Hadham and Standon which offer a butchers, bakers, a convenience store and public houses. The market towns of Bishop's Stortford and Hertford offer multiple shopping and sporting facilities, schooling for all ages and main line railway stations. Vehicular access is available nearby to the A10 and M11 both providing access to the M25 and London to the south with the A1 and Cambridge to the North. Stansted, London's third international airport, is approximately 8 miles away. In addition to excellent state schools in the area there is a choice of private schooling at Bishop's Stortford College, St Edmunds College, Heath Mount and Haileybury College. Local golf courses include Bishop's Stortford, Hanbury Manor and East Herts.

listing.letting_fees:
We often rent properties to people within a matter of days, so it is important to be aware of any costs and charges before finding the property you want to rent.
To protect both you and the landlord there are administration procedures that must be followed as part of the rental process. We have outsourced independent specialists who carry out these procedures for us. This means that in addition to the monthly rent you will be required to pay their charges once we have found you a home to rent.

Administration fees for the property:
Pre-Tenancy Admin fee per applicant (Referencing) - £114pp
Tenancy Agreement Admin Fee per Tenancy (Contribution towards Tenancy Agreement) - £96

Additional Fees may be applicable
Please contact a member of our team on for further information about this.

listing.description: Occupying a glorious position at Cookham Dean, a rare opportunity to purchase a building plot with planning consent granted and enjoying direct Thames frontage of approx. 160ft. The site extends to approx. Two thirds of an acre with planning consent granted for a detached house of just over 3,000 sq. Ft. (rbwm Planning Portal Application Ref. 17/03393).Directions: From Marlow town centre, head over the bridge, turning left just past the Complete Angler Hotel into Quarry Wood Road. Continue along this road heading towards the top of Winter Hill. On reaching the top of the hill and as the road bends to the left, branch immediately to the left by the small village green and continue along the road. On reaching the National Trust viewpoint on the left, with views towards Marlow, proceed for approx. 100 metres where the entrance to Gibraltar Lane will be found as a sharp turning on the left. Continue to the end of the lane where the site is accessed through the top of the entrance to the boatyard.

listing.description: Henry Adams are delighted to offer to the market a fabulous opportunity to purchase a neighbouring pair of three bedroom detached properties located in the popular village of Southwater.The site boasts Outline Planning Consent Permitted (Ref DC/18/2699) for the demolition of the existing two properties to be replaced by a building that can accommodate eight, 2 Bedroom Flats, complete with associated parking and landscaping.Although Outline Planning Consent has been granted to replace the existing buildings with a new scheme, any successful purchaser may of course decide to retain both existing properties. Both dwellings would benefit from some updating and investment, although they are generally presented in reasonable order, having been let out in recent years.One of the dwellings is formed as a detached 3 bedroom house, with neutral décor, fitted kitchen and ground floor cloakroom, dining room and separate sitting/living room. Upstairs there are three bedrooms, two of which are doubles and a slightly smaller single. A family bathroom serves all bedrooms. The property boasts gas fired central heating and partial UPVC double glazed windows. Outside there is a well proportioned garden to the front and rear with a detached single garage/workshop.The second property is a detached 3 bedroom bungalow, a little more dated than the neighbouring property but decorated in neutral colours and boasting a fitted kitchen, lounge/dining room, 3 bedrooms and family bathroom. Electric storage heaters and the property features partially glazed UPVC windows. Outside there is a well proportioned front and rear garden, complete with a detached single garage/workshop.OutsideBoth properties boast access off the Worthing Road leading to a parking area to the front. There is access to the side/rear of the properties which each lead to single garage.SituationThe popular village of Southwater has much to offer, including Lintot Square which boasts a variety of local businesses including a Co-op, florist, hairdressers, restaurant and café.Southwater also boasts a number of public houses, a large doctors' surgery and Southwater Country Park.Regular bus services run to Horsham town centre with its great transport links to London and the South Coast plus excellent educational facilities.Map ImagesDetached HouseDetached HouseDetached HouseDetached BungalowDetached BungalowDetached BungalowFor clarification, Henry Adams wish to inform prospective purchasers, that these sales particulars have been prepared in good faith to give a fair overall view of the property.We have not undertaken a structural survey, nor tested that any of the services, appliances, equipment or facilities are in good working order. Any area, distances or measurements referred to are given as a guide only and should not be relied upon.If such details are fundamental to a purchase please contact this office for further information. All measurements are approximate and should not be relied upon for carpets or furnishings.Details correct: 20th May 2019

listing.description: A rare opportunity has arisen to purchase a 9.5 acre smallholding (currently running as a turkey business) set in an idyllic location within metropolitan greenbelt.Planning permission  There is current planning permission to erect a 3 bedroom detached bungalow where a mobile home is currently sited. The dwelling will occupy a dedicated plot within the farm site and as such is a dwelling for agricultural worker/business owner.The planning permission granted is for a high quality single storey home of approximately 1,400 sq ft. An existing driveway and parking area is already in place.Turkey barn 91' 10" x 26' 2" (28m x 8m) This barn is currently in use by the owners and planning permission has been granted for a further barn of the same size which has been started with a base and drainage laid. There is also permission for a polytunnel as part of this application.  There is a road frontage of approximately 200 meters which is secluded from view but if opened up could be an ideal shop window onto the A127.  At the rear of the site a 6 block stable with tack rooms can also be accessed via a 2nd entrance from the lane.Woodland  Approximately 3 acres of predominately Oak woodland full of wildlife has been used to rear pigs in the past.Boundary  The entire boundary is secured with deer fencing.Services   the site benefits from services for mains gas, water and electricity along with a Klargester drainage system.Development covenant  The land is being sold subject to an overage covenant. Should planning permission be granted for a residential development within a period of 25 years from the date of sale then 5% shall be payable to the vendors. Such sum to be index-linked.

listing.description: Fantastic development site on old bedford road with planning for 4 flat and 2 X 3 bedroom houses...My-Estate are proud to offer this superb development site, located on Old Bedford Road. This site has recently had planning permission granted for the premises of The English Rose pub to be converted into 3 x 2 bedroom flats, and x 1 bedroom flat, along with the erection of a two story side extension comprising 2 x 3 bedroom houses.Location:This large plot occupies a prominent position on the popular Old Bedford road area, which benefits from its proximity to Junction 11 of the M1 motorway, and the M25 motorway Junction 6A is located 12 miles from Luton. Luton has regular rail services to London and the Midlands and offers a choice of three separate railway stations being Luton Parkway Airport, Luton and Leagrave. A typical train journey from London to Luton will take approximately 30-45 minutes. The plot less that a 10 minute walk to Luton train station, town hall and shopping centre. Almost every conceivable amenity is within walking distance from the site.This site has huge development potential - viewing is highly advised.Exterior:The original 'English Rose' pub premises occupies a prominent position, with many original features. The plot has an access gate for vehicles, and the two-story side extension comprising the 2 x 3 bedroom houses would be built on the current premises beer garden. Both houses would enjoy generous back gardens.Additional Information:Luton is a vibrant, multicultural and cosmopolitan community. listing.description: A five bedroom detached family home situated in a delightful rural location with detached oak framed garaging and ample parking set within gardens and grounds approaching 3 acres that include a detached stable block with hay store and tack room, superb sand school and paddock areas. The property is approached via automated gates that leads to a more than generous parking area. The property is well presented throughout and the accommodation briefly comprises of a reception hall, a living room which is open plan to the dining room, a well-appointed kitchen and utility room, a bedroom with an en suite bathroom, a further bedroom and bathroom on the ground floor whilst on the first floor there is a master bedroom with an en suite shower room and a private balcony terrace and two further bedrooms one of which is en suite. Outside the landscaped gardens and excellent equestrian facilities are a key feature. The formal gardens extend to approx. 0.75 of an acre and feature large paved terraces and level lawn areas with a dining hut with seating for ten. There is a detached stable block with a covered hay store and an adjoining feed store and tack room. The sand school measures 20 x 40 meters with a flexi ride surface and gated access from both sides. There are paddock areas with a secondary road access that extend to approx. 2 acres. Set in a rural location with fine views yet easily accessible to both Edenbridge and Oxted Town centres for every day conveniences.

listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.
listing.description: Set in a most idyllic location overlooking farmland and open countryside, a rare opportunity to acquire a 1/3 acre plot with full planning consent to build a brand new luxury detached residence with circa 4500 sq ft of living accommodation over 3 floors.The current owners have recently obtained full planning consent to create an exceptional detached new build residence, designed by David Parker Architects. The remit was to design a contemporary style residence, providing light and airy living space together with incorporating the latest sustainable modern construction. With luxurious accommodation set out over three floors, this stunning home will feature four spacious double bedrooms on the first floor, all with provision for built in wardrobes, with the master and guest rooms also benefitting from en suite facilities. The ground floor will offer an imposing, double height hallway with windows over the landing area, providing ample natural light. At the heart of the house will be a stunning open plan kitchen leading through to a family room. The lounge will offer views to the front and a large open fire will be the focal point of the room. The lower ground floor will comprise of a superb 6m x 5.8m room which has been designed to incorporate a games area and wine room, with external access to the rear terrace and garden. In addition, there will be two additional rooms offering a good degree of versatility; currently designed as a study and hobbies room but one or both could easily could be utilised as bedroom accommodation.SituationColeshill is a village community in an ideal location with easy access to the nearby towns of Amersham and Beaconsfield and their wide range of amenities, shops and stations. Coleshill has a church, various clubs, societies, popular pubs and a duck pond. The village was designated in 1922 as an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and offers great country walks. Buckinghamshire is renowned for its high quality schooling options, both state and private, and the village has an infant school with an outstanding Ofsted rating. Amersham station, 2.6 miles away, has Metropolitan line services to Baker Street and The City, also Chiltern line services to London Marylebone. Beaconsfield station at 3.7 miles also has Chiltern Line services to London Marylebone.OutsideThe grounds measure approximately 0.32 acres.Additional InformationFurther information relating to the planning consent can be found on  - using the reference: Pl/18/2946/fa

listing.description: A fantastic opportunity to acquire a building plot of nearly half an acre with full planning consent for a 5 bedroom, 3 bathroom detached house with double garage. The resulting property would have a West facing garden backing directly onto fields situated in a premier residential road in Pangbourne. A footpath at the end of the road provides a shortcut to the station and village centre is also within walking distance. The current owner has paid the Community Infrastructure Levy (cil). All the documents for the planning consent can be viewed here: Local informationPangbourne is an exceptionally pleasant and well supported village. Standing on the south side of the River Thames where it meets the Pang, Pangbourne lies between rolling Berkshire Downland to the South and the start of the Chiltern Hills to the North. This thriving and active village is a focal point for the surrounding countryside and offers superb transport links with fast mainline railway service to Reading and London, Paddington (from 45 mins) with Crossrail allowing faster direct access to the City, Canary Wharf, the West End and Heathrow from 2019. J12 of the M4 is only a short drive away. As well as several award winning independent shops, Pangbourne has excellent schools, both in the private and the state sector, a large modern Health and Medical Centre, riverside pubs and restaurants. There are excellent sporting and leisure facilities and an active community with its own village magazine, and many societies and associations. There are many country and riverside walks, with public footpaths and bridle ways giving access to miles of open countryside and the beautiful beech woods of the Chiltern Hills.AccommodationThe planning consent is for a two storey house with the following accommodation:Entrance lobby, cloakroom, reception hall, sitting room, dining room, family room, kitchen/breakfast room opening to vaulted garden room, utility room, galleried landing, 5 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms (2 en suite).Detached double garage.Location PlanPlease note this plan is for location purposes only and shows the entirety of the plot formerly occupied by Camden Ridge. The plot offered for sale, is the northern half of this plot.Proposed ElevationsProposed Garage ElevationProposed Ground Floor PlanProposed First Floor Planoutside spaceWith a plot of nearly half an acre with interesting contours, the buyer has the opportunity of creating beautiful West-facing gardens adjoining fields. The consent also allows for a detached double garage.Local authority and servicesWest Berkshire Council, Newbury - There are all main services available in the road.ConveyancingThrough our in house Conveyancing team, we can ensure ease and efficiency for a competitive, no-sale, no-fee quote. Ask us for a quote today.DisclaimerThese particulars are a general guide only. They do not form part of any contract. Services, systems and appliances have not been tested.Buyers informationIn accordance with hmrc Anti Money Laundering Regulations a buyer(s) must attend our office to provide Photo Identification and Proof of Address (valid in last 3 months) once a sale is agreed.

listing.description: Mayhew estates are pleased to offer for sale the opportunity to acquire a speculative plot situated in the popular village of Manning Heath. The site is formed of an overgrown area formerly the Swallowfields nursery off Church Road and positioned to the West of Church Lane within the designated built up area of Mannings Heath.Direct surroundings are characterised by open country side, woodland and neighbouring properties are located to the North and South of the site. The site includes a pond to the North West corner with a number of trees subject to tree preservation orders positioned around its perimeter.Boundaries of the site consist of a mix of hedging and mature tress which screen the site from wider landscape. This land is offered for sale with no planning permission but a detailed history of the site can be viewed at the Horsham District council website. Enquiries should be satisfied by searching the Horsham district council website and viewing the previous planning updates including a favourable overview on outline planning.

listing.description: The proposed property will blend the traditional Kent style house with a contemporary interior, under floor heating provided by a ground source heating system and electricity provided by solar panels to create an extermely efficient, low cost, low environmental impact house for modern living.Access to the house from Maltmans Hill has already been created by a large, stone walled turning circle which accesses the already constructed, detached 4 bay garage with climate controlled office above. The driveways have been excavated and built ready to be surfaced.The house will sit well within the garden curtilage and overlook two wondeful spring fed ponds which have been cleaned out with a weir constructed to control the water level and a pump installed to create a waterfall to oxygenate the water. The ponds are fully stocked with fish and reside within a picturesque bluebell wood. The rear of the house will also overlook open fields and the remaninder of the 4.25 acre site which features a second entrance from Romden Road opening the potenial for equestrian facilities if required.The site comprises an existing 3 bedroom bungalow which is habitable and could be lived in during the construction of the proposed new build which is set well back from the existing house. Planning stipulates however that the bungalow must be demolished after the new building is completed.A new Klargester sewage treatment plant has been installed which hasdischarge consent from the Environment Agency. Two separate mains electricity supplies are provided, ducting and service cable connections have also been laid.Full plans can be obtained by visiting the Ashford Borough Council planning portal with the following link: />Glenwood enjoys a rural setting, on theedge of the picturesque village of Smarden.This quintessential English village has won‘The Prettiest Village’ award on a number ofoccasions and boasts a church, pubs/inns andshops catering for day -to-day needs.A more comprehensive range of shopping, recreational and educational facilities are available at Tenterden, Ashford, Cranbrook and TunbridgeWells.For commuters, Pluckley, Headcorn and AshfordStations provide regular services to LondonBridge, Charing Cross, Cannon Street and St.Pancras.The M20 is easily accessible ensuringquick communications with other motorwaynetworks, the Channel Tunnel, London andGatwick, Heathrow and Stansted airports.Educational opportunities in the region areexcellent, in both the independent and statesectors and Smarden village is fortunate to haveits own primary school.

listing.description: Extending in total to approximately 39 acres situated in an Area of Outstanding Beauty and including a variety of lakes, fields and woodland.The land is made up of several paddocks, areas of woodland and a set of lakes. Several paddocks lie to the South and the East of Rosemary Lane and comprises of approximately 14.5 acres (5.87 hectares) and is made up of pasture land arranged in three individual fields all laid to grass with the benefit of a woodland buffer strip to the South of Rosemary Lane. A further parcel of pasture land divided by a combination of established hedgerows, post and wire fencing and tree lined buffer strips. There is gated access from Rosemary Lane and also a vehicular right of way up an unmade chalk road leading off of the highway.In addition there is a further block of approximately 15 acres (6.1 hectares) of woodland, further pasture land and four fishing lakes. The lakes being stocked with fish for amenity purposes. A additional area of 8.5 acres (3.4 hectares) of pasture land enclosed by established hedgerows and post and rail fencing. We should add that there is an area hatched on the plan which is unregistered land and over which the owners have enjoyed free use and enjoyment of. The total area of land is approximately 38.1 acres (15.42 hectares) excluding some unregistered land which is the further 1.06 acres (0.43 hectares).Viewings strictly by prior appointment.Planning:The land is situated in the Green Belt, in an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and an Area of Great Landscape Value. The land can be used for agricultural woodland and piscatorial purposes as well as equestrian facilities and even though the land lies adjacent to the lakes it does not show as residing in the Environmental Agency Flood Zone.We have also been advised that in the lower paddocks there is now planning consent to erect agricultural buildings.

listing.description: Situated in an Area of Outstanding Beauty, the land is made up of several paddocks, areas of woodland and a set of lakes. Several paddocks lie to the South and the East of Rosemary Lane and comprises of approximately 14.5 acres (5.87 hectares) and is made up of pasture land arranged in three individual fields all laid to grass with the benefit of a woodland buffer strip to the South of Rosemary Lane. A further parcel of pasture land divided by a combination of established hedgerows, post and wire fencing and tree lined buffer strips. There is gated access from Rosemary Lane and also a vehicular right of way up an unmade chalk road leading off of the highway. In addition, there is a further block of approximately 15 acres (6.1 hectares) of woodland, further pasture land and four fishing lakes. The lakes being stocked with fish for amenity purposes. An additional area of 8.5 acres (3.4 hectares) of pasture land enclosed by established hedgerows and post and rail fencing. We should add that there is an area hatched on the plan which is unregistered land and over which the owners have enjoyed free use and enjoyment of. The total area of land is approximately 38.1 acres (15.42 hectares) excluding some unregistered land which is the further 1.06 acres (0.43 hectares). PlanningThe land is situated in the Green Belt, in an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and an Area of Great Landscape Value. The land can be used for agricultural woodland and piscatorial purposes as well as equestrian facilities and even though the land lies adjacent to the lakes it does not show as residing in the Environmental Agency Flood Zone. We have also been advised that in the lower paddocks there is now planning consent to erect agricultural buildings.*Additional Information from our Clients*The Land in Rosemary lane is permanent pasture and has been farmed by myself for some 20yrs. It is registered with the rpa and eligible for bps and is currently in the 4th year of my css high tier scheme which runs for one more year. The land is managed to a high environmental standard with no fertilizers and sprays. There is a rich flora and fauna including many species of fungi mushrooms which are notably indicative of ancient grazed pastures. The birdlife is abundant with Kingfishers and nightingales amongst the species. The grants and bps running with the rpa provides an income to the farming business. The countrysidestewardship would have to be maintained until the end of 2020.Rpa – The Rural Payments Agency bps – Basic Payment Scheme css – Countryside Stewardship SchemeThe Land is set in beautiful open countryside in a tranquil setting on the outskirts of the village of Alfold being surrounded by many acres of open farmland. The village itself offers a local shop catering for daily needs and a 13th Century church. It is situated on the Surrey/Sussex borders and there are many footpaths, tracks and bridleways through forestry commission land along the Wey & Arun Canal. There is a village hall and a sports ground. The larger village of Cranleigh is approximately 6 miles away and the more comprehensive facilities of Guildford and Horsham are approximately 12 and 8 miles respectively.

listing.description: This excellently located and consented development site is situated on one of west Maidstone's premier roads and is offered with detailed planning permission for the construction of 3 no. Detached family homes.LocationLocated on Bower Mount Road, one of west Maidstone's premier urban roads, the site is around a mile from Maidstone town centre which offers a wide range of shops, services, restaurants, bars and other leisure activities.The site is close to a number of excellent Primary, Secondary and Grammar schools as well as Shernold School, a private Kindergarten and Prep School just north of the site on Queen's Avenue.The site is well located for commuting with Junction 5 of the M20 motorway around 2 miles to the north west. Maidstone East station is around a mile to the east and offers frequent services to various London stations with a journey time of around an hour.Site DescriptionThe site extends c. 0.17 ha (c. 0.42 acres) in size. It is irregular in shape and falls from front to back with several undulations and changes in level. It was formerly part of the leisure area of The Grove Residential Care Home. The frontage onto Bower Mount Road extends to c. 30m and is dominated by an attractive Kentish Ragstone wall. This will need to be broken through in order to create the access to the site. There are a number of mature trees at the site with the majority at the rear to the northern boundary.Planning And The Proposed SchemePlanning permission was secured at an Appeal under reference app/U2235/W/18/3212900 with a Decision dated 6th February 2019. The Inspector issued the positive Decision with just 11 no. Conditions, none of which are considered unusual or onerous for development of this type in this location.The proposed scheme comprises 3 no. Detached houses served by a new private drive from Bower Mount Road. Plot 1010 is located to the front of the site and the proposed layout shows a large 5 bed house with 2 en-suite bathrooms and an integral double garage. Plot 1020 is to the rear of the site and comprises another large 5 bed house with an en-suite bathroom to each bedroom and an integral double garage. Plot 1030 is to the rear of the site in the corner and is a large 4 bed house again with an en-suite bathroom to each bedroom and an integral double garage.Externally, each property has private parking for two cars and the site plan shows two visitor spaces. Each property also benefits from a good sized private garden to the rear.Restrictions/Covenants1. The vendor will require a legal restriction allowing only the development and sale of 3 no. Private dwelling houses on the site that adheres reasonably closely to Consented scheme. This is to prevent any alternative development at the site that has the potential to impact on his retained business at The Grove Residential Care Home.2. The proposed new access through the existing ragstone wall caused significant concern at the planning application stage. The vendor wants to respect his neighbours concerns and will require the purchaser to ensure that the new access to the development site is attractively designed and uses the matching ragstone from the demolished part of the wall. Also that any installed gate or barrier allows any passerby to see the open nature of the development with its high quality design and landscaping.3.The vendor will require confirmation that he will be fully consulted in respect of any proposed amendments to the Consented scheme, prior to the submission of any planning application/or application for minor amendment or the commencement of any worksCommunity Infrastructure LevyIt is understood that the proposed scheme will be liable for Community Infrastructure Levy. The vendor has submitted a cil Determining Form suggesting the development extends to 720 m2 resulting in a current cil Liability of £65,720. However, this may change dependent on the size of the development that is ultimately constructed and the charging schedule at the time.Further InformationCopies of the planning documents and proposed plans and elevations as well as other reports are available to download from our website at .TenureThe site is to be sold on a freehold basis with vacant possession upon completion.ServicesInterested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the relevant statutory authorities to ensure availability and sufficient capacity at the site in order to service and drain the proposed development.VatIt is understood that VAT will not be applied to this transaction.Viewing ArrangementsCurrent access to the site is through the adjacent Residential Care Home. In order to respect the privacy and to limit the potential disturbance to the residents is requested that no unannounced visits to the site are undertaken. listing.short_description:
This excellently located and consented development site is situated on one of west Maidstone's premier roads and is offered with detailed planning permission for the construction of 3 no. Detached family homes.

Location

Located on Bower Mount Road, one of west Maidstone's premier urban roads, the site is around a mile from Maidstone town centre which offers a wide range of shops, services, restaurants, bars and other leisure activities. The site is close to a number of excellent Primary, Secondary and Grammar schools as well as Shernold School, a private Kindergarten and Prep School just north of the site on Queen's Avenue. The site is well located for commuting with Junction 5 of the M20 motorway around 2 miles to the north west. Maidstone East station is around a mile to the east and offers frequent services to various London stations with a journey time of around an hour.

Site Description

The site extends c. 0.17 ha (c. 0.42 acres) in size. It is irregular in shape and falls from front to back with several undulations and changes in level. It was formerly part of the leisure area of The Grove Residential Care Home. The frontage onto Bower Mount Road extends to c. 30m and is dominated by an attractive Kentish Ragstone wall. This will need to be broken through in order to create the access to the site. There are a number of mature trees at the site with the majority at the rear to the northern boundary.

Planning And The Proposed Scheme

Planning permission was secured at an Appeal under reference app/U2235/W/18/3212900 with a Decision dated 6th February 2019. The Inspector issued the positive Decision with just 11 no. Conditions, none of which are considered unusual or onerous for development of this type in this location. The proposed scheme comprises 3 no. Detached houses served by a new private drive from Bower Mount Road. Plot 1010 is located to the front of the site and the proposed layout shows a large 5 bed house with 2 en-suite bathrooms and an integral double garage. Plot 1020 is to the rear of the site and comprises another large 5 bed house with an en-suite bathroom to each bedroom and an integral double garage. Plot 1030 is to the rear of the site in the corner and is a large 4 bed house again with an en-suite bathroom to each bedroom and an integral double garage. Externally, each property has private parking for two cars and the site plan shows two visitor spaces. Each property also benefits from a good sized private garden to the rear.

Restrictions/Covenants

1. The vendor will require a legal restriction allowing only the development and sale of 3 no. Private dwelling houses on the site that adheres reasonably closely to Consented scheme. This is to prevent any alternative development at the site that has the potential to impact on his retained business at The Grove Residential Care Home. 2. The proposed new access through the existing ragstone wall caused significant concern at the planning application stage. The vendor wants to respect his neighbours concerns and will require the purchaser to ensure that the new access to the development site is attractively designed and uses the matching ragstone from the demolished part of the wall. Also that any installed gate or barrier allows any passerby to see the open nature of the development with its high quality design and landscaping. 3.The vendor will require confirmation that he will be fully consulted in respect of any proposed amendments to the Consented scheme, prior to the submission of any planning application/or application for minor amendment or the commencement of any works

Community Infrastructure Levy

It is understood that the proposed scheme will be liable for Community Infrastructure Levy. The vendor has submitted a cil Determining Form suggesting the development extends to 720 m2 resulting in a current cil Liability of £65,720. However, this may change dependent on the size of the development that is ultimately constructed and the charging schedule at the time.

Further Information

Copies of the planning documents and proposed plans and elevations as well as other reports are available to download from our website at .

Tenure

The site is to be sold on a freehold basis with vacant possession upon completion.

Services

Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the relevant statutory authorities to ensure availability and sufficient capacity at the site in order to service and drain the proposed development.

Vat

It is understood that VAT will not be applied to this transaction.

Viewing Arrangements

Current access to the site is through the adjacent Residential Care Home. In order to respect the privacy and to limit the potential disturbance to the residents is requested that no unannounced visits to the site are undertaken. We have arranged 3 viewing mornings on Thursday 2nd May, Thursday 16th May and Tuesday 28th May. If you would like to view the site on any of the dates please contact the agent to book a time slot.

Offers

Unconditional offers are invited by way of informal tender for the freehold interest, subject only to contract. The closing date for offers is Friday 31st May 2019. All offers should be accompanied with evidence of funding, your anticipated timescale from agreement to an exchange of contracts and details of any due diligence that you will require and intend to undertake prior to an exchange of contracts. As a Regulated industry under anti-money laundering regulations rpc Land & New Homes will need to verify the identify of all purchasers of the site and this will be completed before Heads of Terms are issued. The vendor is not obligated to accept the highest or any bid made.

These particulars are for guidance and whilst we endeavour to make our details as reliable as possible if there is any point which is of particular importance please contact the office and we will be pleased to check the information for you. All measurements are as accurate as possible at time of going to press. All plans are not to scale.

listing.description: Unique development opportunity to rebuild a Modernist, la style home measuring approx 4,000 square feet situated on approx 1 acre. A triple 2 story garage measuring approx 540 square feet will provide space for 3 cars, plus a gym/workshop and wet room underneath. The extensions have been cleverly designed to utilise the existing bungalow minimising build cost. There is no cil and Section 106 to pay. This is a rare opportunity ideal for self-builders or developers to construct a home with wow factor.The hidden away South facing plot has a carriage driveway with ample parking. listing.description: Location:The holding is located approximately one mile to north-west of Robertsbridge and 3.5 miles to the north-east of Brightling. The coast at Hastings is approximately 12 miles to the south-east and Tunbridge Wells is approximately 17 miles to the north-west.Description:The property is registered under title number ESX198886 (part of) and comprises a number of hedge enclosed fields, predominately down to grass with scattered woodland shaws. The land is classified as Grade III on the Agricultural Land Classification Plan for England and Wales, with the soils being described as Ashdown Beds comprising sands and silts, with subordinate clays.A two-bay pole barn/shelter (now in need of re-roofing) is located within the north-western corner of one of the fields on the western boundary.The holding extends in all to about 94 acres.Tenure:The property is offered for sale by private treaty with vacant possession upon completion.Local authorty:Rother District Councilservices:We understand that a mains water supply is available.Easements, wayleaves and rights of way:The property is sold subject to and with the benefit of all existing rights whether public or private including rights of way, supply, drainage, water and electricity supplies or other rights, covenants, restrictions and obligations, quasi-easements and all wayleaves whether referred to or not within these particulars.Public footpaths cross part of the land to the north east and along the eastern boundary.Minerals, sporting rights and timber:All mineral rights, sporting rights and standing timber so far as they are owned are included in the Freehold.Directions:From Robertsbridge High Street, proceed in a westerly direction on Station Road (which becomes Brightling Road) for approximately 0.9 miles and then turn right into Bugsell Lane. Continue along Bugsell Lane (bearing left where it joins Langham Road) for approximately 0.3 miles, wherafter an entrance gate leading to the land will be found on the right-hand side. Please refer to the agent for details of other access points.Plans:The attached plans are for identification purposes only.BoundariesThe purchaser must satisfy themselves on the location of all boundaries from the Land Registry documentation available.Access:The property can be accessed via both adopted and unadopted lanes.Viewing:Strictly by appointment with the Vendor's Sole Agents, btf Partnership - Telephone: Prior to making an appointment to view, the agents recommend that you discuss any particular points which are likely to affect your interest in the property with a member of staff. This will help to ensure that you do not make a wasted journey.Please ensure that when viewing the property, you do so with due care, taking responsibility for your actions.Agent's notes:Money laundering regulations:In accordance with Money Laundering Regulations, we are now required to obtain proof of identification for all purchasers.Btf employs the services of Smartsearch to verify the identity and address of purchasers.Overage provision:The land will be sold subject to a 30% overage provision, which will be triggered in the event of planning consent being granted for residential development within a period of 25 years from the date of sale.AcreagesThe acreages quoted are for guidance purposes only and are given without responsibility. Any intending purchasers should not rely upon them as statement or representation of fact and must satisfy themselves by inspection or otherwise.Basic payment scheme entitlementsBps entitlements are not included.

listing.short_description:
Development opportunity - planning consent passed for two town houses. 5 potential schemes all revealing different gdv and profit. Please call the office for more information.

Agents Note

There are four option which seem possible for the re development of the property.

Option 1

The property currently has planning consent to demolish the existing building and rebuild two new large townhouse style properties. This in my opinion if the wrong was to go as demolishing the property only to rebuild the same does not make financial sense.

Option 2

Apply for the third house in a different way, Maybe as a coach house style where you maintain the parking to the right.

Option 3

Ignore the current planning consent and apply to amend it to keep the existing structure dividing two properties at the natural line of extension. This will minimise the build cost. Each property would then benefit from a ground floor extension to the rear increasingly living accommodation. Each property within also benefit from a loft conversion giving the extra two bedrooms per property. This would result in a five bedroom mid terrace townhouse and a four-bedroom end of terrace townhouse. Competing values on the development behind are in the £750,000 and and £850,000 pound price range. We would suggest a value of £700,000 pounds for the five bedroom mid terrace townhouse and £700,000 for the smaller four-bedroom end of texts. A larger mid terrace should achieve the same as a small end of terrace. We estimate a build cost to be in the region of £250,000 Giving gdv of £1.4 million. After a purchase of £675,000 and a build of £250,000 Also allowing £50,000 Fees There appears to be a profit in the range of £400,000.

Option 4

Applied to extend the property to the right leaving an underpass to get through to the rear garden for parking and apply to construct between six and eight apartments.

Option 5

Combining options two and three
